column4: Hello everyone!  I'm trying to write a bootable WinXP-CD from Ubuntu.  2 problems. (1) - it won't write to the CD  - problem seems to be that the i386 folder wont copy.  Maybe 6000 files in one folder is more than it can handle.  And (2) I cannot find any mention of a Bootable CD.   How do I make one?
what burning app do you use? so far only k3b can make bootable cds from 0
I'm using the standard one that comes with Ubuntu.  thanks...  I'll search for it.
its a bit tricky even with k3b. the boot catalog thing is hidden. i suggest using isomaster to turn it into an iso and bunt it like an iso. isomaster is far mor convenient
Thanks!
well the only key on my keyboard that does not work is saying "Files" and its supposed to open "my documents" in xp. all the rest like WWW, Email, Volume +, Mute etc work
close every app you have there. it could be a seeding torrent up on the background
thx
network manager
yer but what do I do with it?
remove it and install wicd             wicd.sourceforge.net
nice.  ok gotta go now - I'll do it when I'm back.  thx.
lol. ok. do not download the .deb file and double click install. USE THE REPO of wicd to install from apt
wicked. ok.
could you help me get a WAP running?  I'm very stuck...
sure, hit it
Can I do the whole thing without any GUI stuff?  No network manager, no wicd, etc?
theoritically, yes. practically... i have tried connecting with wep and it all went wrong
i could connect if i disabled wep key from the hotspot, but its no use
I'm not using wep.  I'm going for like a 'hello world' WAP
wap as in... www for cellphones etc?? i thought of wpa. damn
I'm trying to get my housemates online
I have a wifi card.  I had it working in Heron.  But it's broken now I upgraded to Intrepid.
have you tried disabling nm to see if it works? what model is that card?
